trans-unit.source: Supports the page parser in building a control and the child controls it contains.
By default, every control on a page is associated with a default ControlBuilder class.
During parsing, the ASP.NET page framework builds a tree of ControlBuilder objects corresponding to the tree of controls for the page.
The ControlBuilder tree is then used to generate page code to create the control tree.
In addition to child controls, the ControlBuilder defines the behavior of how the content within control tags is parsed.
You can override this default behavior by defining your own custom control builder class.
This is done by applying a <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlBuilderAttribute> attribute to your control builder class as follows: `[ControlBuilderAttribute(typeof(ControlBuilderType))]`
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create a new instance the <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder> class.
> [!NOTE] > This constructor is generally used by ASP.NET when parsing the page and creating the control hierarchy.
It is not intended for use in your code.
Determines whether white space literals are permitted in the content between a control's opening and closing tags.
This method is called by the ASP.NET page framework.
The AllowWhitespaceLiterals method is used to determine whether white space literals are permitted in the content between the opening and closing tags of a control.
When this method returns `false`, the white space literals are trimmed from the content before the content is processed by the page parser.
When this method returns `true`, the white space literals not removed.
This method is called by the ASP.NET page framework during parsing and is not intended to be called directly in you code.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Adds the specified literal content to a control.
This method is called by the ASP.NET page framework.
Override the AppendLiteralString method to control how literal content between the control's opening and closing tags is processed.
Literal content can be any text that is passed by the browser to the server control.
For example, any HTML elements and text, between their opening and closing tags, are literal content.
The content to add to the control.
The string literal is not well formed.
Adds builders to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object for any child controls that belong to the container control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object assigned to the child control.
Gets the control builder that corresponds to the binding container for the control that this builder creates.
The control builder that corresponds to the binding container for the control.
Gets the type of the binding container for the control that this builder creates.
A <xref:System.Type> that represent the type of the binding container for the control that this builder creates.
Builds a design-time instance of the control that is referred to by this <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object.
The resulting built control.
Called by the parser to inform the builder that the parsing of the control's opening and closing tags is complete.
The CloseControl method is used by the parser to indicate to the builder that it has finished parsing the control.
Gets a collection of complex property entries.
If there are no entries, a static empty collection is returned.
A collection of complex property entries.
Gets the <xref:System.Type> for the control to be created.
The <xref:System.Type> for the control to be created.
Creates a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object from the specified tag name and object type, as well as other parameters defining the builder.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateParser"></xref> object responsible for parsing the control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object responsible for building the parent control.
The <xref:System.Type> of the object that the builder will create.
The name of the tag to be built.
This allows the builder to support multiple tag types.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder.ID*> attribute assigned to the control.
The <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> object that holds all the specified tag attributes.
The source file line number for the specified control.
The name of the source file from which the control is to be created.
The builder that is responsible for creating the control.
Gets an <xref href="System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService"></xref> object that is used to manage device-filter related services when parsing and persisting controls in the designer.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService> interface is an interface that is specific to how a control uses device filters in a designer.

When controls are parsed or persisted in the designer outside the context of a browser request, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService> provides a way to determine whether the current control is affected by a named filter and whether a named filter is part of a specific device-filter hierarchy.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService"></xref> object that is used to manage device filter related services when parsing and persisting controls in the designer.
Gets the type that will be used by code generation to declare the control.
The <xref:System.Type> of the control used by code generation to declare the control.
Represents the `"__designer"` literal string.
To be added.

Gets a value that determines whether the control has a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute"></xref> with <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute.ChildrenAsProperties*> set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control has a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute"></xref> with <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute.ChildrenAsProperties*> set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that determines whether the control implements the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IParserAccessor"></xref> interface.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the control implements the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IParserAccessor"></xref> interface, otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Obtains the <xref:System.Type> of the control type corresponding to a child tag.
This method is called by the ASP.NET page framework.
This method is called by the ASP.NET page framework during parsing and is not intended to be called directly in you code.
The tag name of the child.
An array of attributes contained in the child control.
The <xref:System.Type> of the specified control's child.
Creates the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ObjectPersistData"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.ObjectPersistData"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref>.
Retrieves the resource key for this <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object.
The resource key for this <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the control contains any code blocks.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control contains at least one code block; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Determines if a control has both an opening and closing tag.
This method is called by the ASP.NET page framework.
This method is called by the ASP.NET page framework during parsing and is not intended to be called directly in you code.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control has an opening and closing tag; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether the literal string of an HTML control must be HTML decoded.
This method is called by the ASP.NET page framework.
A literal string refers to the text between the opening and closing tag of an HTML control.
HTML encoding is when text is converted into a string representation that the browser will display rather than interpret as HTML.

Characters such as the question mark (?), ampersand (&), slash mark (/), and spaces might be truncated or corrupted by some browsers, so those characters must be encoded when they appear in `a` tags or in query strings.
The HtmlDecodeLiterals method is called by the ASP.NET page framework during parsing and is not intended to be called directly in you code.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the HTML control literal string is to be decoded; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the identifier property for the control to be built.
The identifier property for the control.
Returns whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> is running in the designer.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> is running in the designer; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Initializes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> for use after it is instantiated.
This method is called by the ASP.NET page framework.
This method is called by the ASP.NET page framework during parsing and is not intended to be called directly in you code.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateParser"></xref> object responsible for parsing the control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object responsible for building the parent control.
The <xref:System.Type> assigned to the control that the builder will create.
The name of the tag to be built.
This allows the builder to support multiple tag types.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder.ID*> attribute assigned to the control.
The <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> object that holds all the specified tag attributes.
Gets a Boolean value indicating whether this <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object is used to generate page themes.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to use this <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> to generate page themes; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the type set on the binding container.
The type set on the binding container.
Gets a Boolean value indicating whether the control that is created by this <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object is localized.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the control created by this <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object is localized; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the type of the naming container for the control that this builder creates.
A <xref:System.Type> that represent the type of the naming container for the control that this builder creates.
Determines if the control builder needs to get its inner text.
If so, the <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder.SetTagInnerText*> method must be called.
This method is called by the ASP.NET page framework.
The inner text is the text between the opening and closing tags of the control.
This method is called by the ASP.NET page framework during parsing and is not intended to be called directly in you code.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control builder needs to get its inner text.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> that it is being added to a parent control builder.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object to which the current builder is added.
Gets the virtual path of a page to be built by this <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> instance.
The virtual path of the page to be built.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateParser"></xref> responsible for parsing the control.
This property retrieves the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateParser> responsible for parsing the control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateParser"></xref> used to parse the control.
Enables custom control builders to access the generated Code Document Object Model (CodeDom) and insert and modify code during the process of parsing and building controls.

In the single-file page model, the `baseType` and `derivedType` parameters are the same <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeTypeDeclaration> type, which typically derives from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class.

In the code-behind page model, `baseType` is the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeTypeDeclaration> type that represents the partial code-behind class, which is typically derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class.
The `derivedType` parameter is the class that derives from the partial class that contains the markup.
For more information about ASP.NET Web page models, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Syntax Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
For more information about how to use the CodeDOM to represent and generate source code, see [Dynamic Source Code Generation and Compilation](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The root container of a CodeDOM graph of the control that is being built.
The base type of the page or user control that contains the control that is being built.
The derived type of the page or user control that contains the control that is being built.
The code that is used to build the control.
The code that is used to build the data-binding method of the control.
Gets the service object for this <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object.
An <xref:System.IServiceProvider> that represents the service object for this <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref>.
Sets the resource key for this <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object.
The resource key for this <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref>.
Sets the service object for this <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object.
An <xref:System.IServiceProvider> that represents the service object for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref>.
Provides the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> with the inner text of the control tag.
This method is called only if <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder.NeedsTagInnerText%2A> previously returned `true`.
The text to be provided.
Gets a list of child <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> objects for this <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object.
A list of child <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> objects.
Gets the tag name for the control to be built.
The tag name for the control.
Gets a collection of template property entries.
If there are no entries, a static empty collection is returned.
A collection of template property entries.
Gets an <xref href="System.Web.UI.IThemeResolutionService"></xref> object that is used in design time to manage control themes and skins.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.IThemeResolutionService> interface is a container for one or more <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeProvider> objects, which in turn supply the <xref:System.Web.UI.SkinBuilder> objects that apply themes and control skins to controls when they are created in a designer.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.IThemeResolutionService"></xref> object that is used in design time to manage control themes and skins.
